chainsaw.lazy.filtersaw — Filtering chainsaw¶

class chainsaw.lazy.filtersaw(*things, **kw)[source]¶

filtering chainsaw

append(*things)¶

Insert things after any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
as_ascii(errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode outgoing things with the 'ascii' codec.

Parameters:errors (string) – error handling for decoding issues
as_bytes(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) – error handling for encoding issues
as_dict()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to dict.

as_list()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to list.

as_many()¶

Treat each incoming thing as one processing unit within a series of multiple processing units.

as_one()¶

Treat multiple incoming things as one processing unit.

as_set()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to set.

as_tuple()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to tuple.

as_unicode(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to unicode (str under Python 3) decode outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) – error handling for decoding issues
attributes(*names)¶

Collect attribute values from things within an iterable that matches an attribute name value found in names.

Parameters:names (string) – attribute names
clear()¶

Clear everything.

duality()¶

Divide one iterable into two iterables, the first being everything the worker evaluates as True and the second being everything the worker evaluates as False.

fetch()¶

Return outgoing things wrapped with the iterable wrapper.

filter(invert=False)¶

Collect each thing within an iterable matched by the worker.

Parameters:invert (boolean) – collect things the worker evaluates as False instead of True
items(*keys)¶

Collect values from things (usually sequences or mappings) within an iterable that match a key value found in keys.

Parameters:keys (string) – item keys (or indexes)
mapping(keys=False, values=False)¶

Collect items, keys, or values from things within an iterable of mappings.

Parameters:
  • keys (boolean) – collect keys only
  • values (boolean) – collect values only
original()¶

Revert incoming things back to original snapshot.

params(*args, **kw)¶

Assign global positional and keyword params used when the worker is invoked.

pattern(pattern, type='parse', flags=0)¶

Compile a search pattern and use it as the worker.

Parameters:
  • pattern (string) – search pattern
  • type (string) – engine to compile pattern with. Valid options are ‘parse’, ‘re’, or ‘glob’
  • flags (integer) – regular expression flags
peek()¶

Preview current state of things wrapped with the iterable wrapper.

prepend(*things)¶

Insert things before any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
rollback()¶

Revert incoming things back to baseline snapshot.

snapshot()¶

Take a snapshot of the current state of incoming things.

Parameters:baseline (boolean) – make snapshot the baseline snapshot
traverse(invert=False)¶

Collect nested values from each thing within an iterable matched by the worker.

Parameters:
  • ancestors (boolean) – collect things from parents of things based on method resolution order (MRO)
  • invert (boolean) – select things that the worker evaluates as False rather than True
undo(snapshot=0)¶

Revert incoming things back to a previous snapshot.

Parameters:snapshot (integer) – number of steps ago e.g. 1, 2, 3
worker(worker)¶

Assign worker.

Parameters:worker – a Python callable
wrapper(wrapper)¶

Assign iterable wrapper for outgoing things.

Parameters:wrapper –

an iterable wrapper
